Types

NativeString = string
Most convenient string type to use for each backend. cstring on JS.   Source Edit 
KnownTags = enum
  noTag, p, br, h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, ul, ol, li, blockquote, sup, sub, em,
  strong, pre, code, u, s, img, input, a, video, audio
Enum of tags used in this library.   Source Edit 
MarggersElement = ref object
  case isText*: bool
  of true:
      str*: NativeString

  else:
      tag*: KnownTags
      attrs*: OrderedTable[NativeString, NativeString]
      content*: seq[MarggersElement]

An individual node.

Can be text, or an HTML element.

HTML element contains tag, attributes, and sequence of nodes.

  Source Edit 
MarggersParserObj = object
  str*: NativeString
  pos*: int
  linkReferrers*: Table[NativeString, seq[MarggersElement]] ## Table of link references to elements that use the reference.
                                                            ## After parsing is done, if this is not empty, then some references
                                                            ## were left unset.
A parser object.   Source Edit 
MarggersParser = ref MarggersParserObj
Reference version of MarggersParserObj. To change to non-ref, do -d:marggersParserUseObj.   Source Edit 
MarggersParserVar = var MarggersParser
  Source Edit 
MarggersParserVarMatcher = distinct MarggersParserVar

proc setLink(elem: MarggersElement; link: NativeString) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Sets element link.

If elem has tag a, sets the href attribute to link. Otherwise if elem has tag img and link ends with .mp4, .m4v, .mov, .ogv or .webm, elem will become a video element, and if link ends with .mp3, .oga, .ogg, .wav or .flac, elem will become an audio element; then the src attribute will be set to link. Other tags for elem also set the src attribute to link.

  Source Edit 
proc toCstring(elem: MarggersElement): cstring {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Outputs a marggers element as HTML as a cstring, mostly for JS.   Source Edit
